statement.p: The value \displaystyle{V} of a used car (in dollars) is a function of the number of miles \displaystyle{m} it has been driven, its age \displaystyle{a} in years, and its original cost \displaystyle{c} in dollars when new. That is, \displaystyle{V}={f{{\left({m},{a},{c}\right)}}}.
Do you expect \displaystyle{\frac{{\partial{V}}}{{\partial{m}}}} to be positive, negative, or zero?
Do you expect \displaystyle{\frac{{\partial{V}}}{{\partial{a}}}} to be positive, negative, or zero?
Do you expect \displaystyle{\frac{{\partial{V}}}{{\partial{c}}}} to be positive, negative, or zero?
